title: April 14
description:
Felix and Milo are on spring break, but Dean and Lucie are not. So this year we're staying in town with the pooch.

The kids went to a cool camp for a couple of days. The rest of the week was filled with many playdates and various outings, some fun (Lake Anza, Six Flags), some not (dentist).

children.title: Lake Anza
children.description:
On the hottest day of 2013 so far, Lucie took Felix, Milo, Connor and Higgsy to Lake Anza.

We were already well familiar with its sandy beach, but we had heard that Lake Anza is a also choice destination for anyone with a water-loving dog.

Unfortunately, we found out that dogs are NOT allowed on the beach and swimming area. Poor Higgsy had to stay in the car while we swam.

After a while, Lucie left the boys to their sandcastle while she took Higgsy on a hike around the lake. She jumped in (fell?) a couple of times but quickly dog paddled back to shore. She seems both terribly excited and a little apprehensive by large bodies of water. A healthy reaction.

children.title: Elf
children.description:
Felix and Milo attended two days of role-playing camp at Trackers Bay.

The concept pleased Felix immensely: it's basically one giant live-action role playing game.

Each day had a different theme. On Middle Earth day, costumes were encouraged. Felix went as an Elf.

children.title: Knight
children.description:
Milo went as a knight.

The camp united the kids on a quest: find the magic bracelet that had been stolen my evil trolls. The camps counselors were part counselors, part actors.

The other day's theme was stealth and camouflage. The boys came home filthy and soot-blackened. It took 3 showers to scrub them clean.

children.title: Karate
children.description:
Milo stopped karate for a few months last fall. Then he decided to pick it up again.

Unfortunately, his posse had graduated to the next belt by then. Still, he stuck to it, patiently waiting for his day of graduation.

children.title: Belt Test
children.description:
Finally, last Friday, Milo got invited to the purple belt test.

Not a week too soon! Soccer just started and the karate beginner's class schedule is incompatible with the soccer practice, which is the main reason Milo dropped karate in the first place.

Thankfully, purple belt classes are held on more convenient days and times.

children.title: Purple Belt
children.description: Congratulation on your purple belt, Milo!

children.title: BBQ
children.description: Lovely evening BBQ in San Luis Park with the Clydes and an assortment of their family and neighbors (including Miriam, August and Ulysses).

children.title: In the Grass
children.description: Bare chested and eating hot dogs in the grass at 7:00 pm on a weekday. A good sign you are on Spring Break.

children.title: Soccer
children.description:
The soccer season started with a bang! Milo's team won their first two games by wide margins, including one goal by Milo himself.

Their success is due in big part by the arrival of several 4th graders on the team. EB had two soccer teams in the fall (one of 3rd graders, one of 4th graders). The two teams got combined because fewer kids play soccer in the Spring (it's baseball season).

Milo is loving the winning streak.

Why the long face, then? Milo is upset that one parent brought a big box of Oreos as a postgame snack. Oreos contain palm oil, which is grown by clearing rainforest, thus depriving the monkeys of their habitat.

Milo convinced all his 3rd grade buddies to boycott the snack but the 4rd graders just shrugged and kept munching. Milo was crestfallen that the entire jumbo box got gobbled up. What's an monkey-loving activist to do?

children.title: Six Flags
children.description:
Six Flags is a big amusement park about 45 min to the north, in Vallejo. This was Lucie's first visit -- the boys had gone with Dean and Nana before.

We took Ulysses with us. We met up with Callum and Tillman and their dad Chris.

children.title: Bumper Cars
children.description:
Like his mother, Felix can't stand roller coasters and other gut spinners.

But bumper cars? THOSE are cool.

children.title: Dolphins
children.description: Six Flags also has some animals. The dolphin show was fantastic!

children.title: Splash Zone
children.description: Milo and Ulysses insisted on sitting in the splash zone. They did get wet but not as soaked as they had hoped.

children.title: Thrilla Gorilla
children.description:
Unlike Lucie and Felix, Milo and Ulysses *love* the thrill of getting shaken up.

Our little monkeys' favorite ride: Thrilla Gorilla. A giant gorilla spins you in his hand.

children.title: Water Ride
children.description:
Callum is also a thrill seeker. Not so much his brother Tillman. This worked out.

Here, Lucie took the three youngsters to a water log ride while Chris took the older boys to go carts.

children.title: Higgy Points
children.description:
We started a reward system to motivate the children into helping more with the dog.

They earn a star (or "higgy point", as Milo calls it) for taking Higgsy on a walk, feeding her, playing with her for a long time, etc.

Five higgy points gets you a dollar.

children.title: Walk
children.description: The higgy points are a smashing success. Higgsy is getting LOTS of attention from the kids and they have taken her on many, many walks.

children.title: Dog Park
children.description:
Higgsy loves our neighborhood dog park and she eagerly rushes toward it if we are anywhere its vicinity.

It's nearly impossible to walk by the dog park and not go in. She is not that strong but it's very hard to resist when she makes puppy eyes at you.

children.title: Sunday Ride
children.description:
Sunday ride. We went for ice cream at Ici, a delicious ice cream parlor in the Elmwood neighborhood on the other side of Berkeley.

What's the red thing that Lucie's pulling behind her?

children.title: Trailer
children.description: Yup, we got a doggie trailer.

children.title: Dog Ride
children.description: A strap hooked to her collar keeps her from jumping out.

children.title: Back Trap
children.description:
The back opens for easy entry. Don't forget to zip it closed before taking off!

Higgsy DID fall out the back once when Felix forgot to close it well. The car behind Lucie honked frantically to let her know she was dragging a dog.
